raw.title: [BIP-564] Enable GHO/pyUSD ECLP Gauge
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/847

>## Summary
>
>@TokenLogic and @karpatkey proposes creating a new GHO/pyUSD Gauge.
>
>GHO/pyUSD E-CLP - Range: -80bps to 50bps
>
> The Aave Liquidity Committee (ALC), Trident Digital and Paxos intend to support this pool by coordinating deposits, voting and sourcing vlAURA votes via the Paladin Bribe market. 

>## References/Useful links
>
>**GHO**
>* [Website](https://app.aave.com/markets/)
>* [Documentation](https://docs.aave.com/hub/)
>* [Github Page](https://github.com/aave/interface)
>* [Communities](https://governance.aave.com/)
>
>**pyUSD**
>* [Paypal](https://www.paypal.com/us/digital-wallet/manage-money/crypto/pyusd)
>* [Paxos](https://paxos.com/pyusd/)
>* [Launch Blog](https://newsroom.paypal-corp.com/2023-08-07-PayPal-Launches-U-S-Dollar-Stablecoin)
>* [Trident Digital](https://twitter.com/TriDigGroup)
>
>## Protocol Description
>
>**GHO & Aave Protocol**
> The Aave Protocol is a decentralized liquidity protocol that is deployed across many EVM compatible networks including but not limited to Optimism, Arbitrum, Avalanche and Polygon. Currently, the Aave Protocol has a TVL of approximately $11.63 Billion.
>
> GHO is a decentralized multi-collateral stable coin that is fully backed, transparent and native to the Aave Protocol.
>
>**pyUSD & Trident**
> PayPal is a globally recognized leader in the payments and remittance industry. Its entrance to the crypto space with the launch of pyUSD represents a significant step into the Web3 world as the company looks to expand and improve its product offerings.
>
> Launched in August 2023, pyUSD is a partnership between PayPal and the Paxos Trust Company, whose previous assets include USDP and BUSD. The code for pyUSD is built on Paxos previous success with the aforementioned USDP token. Paxos is a New York State Department of Financial Services regulated Trust that acts as a qualified custodian of fully bankruptcy remote and segregated funds. Paxos issued coins such as pyUSD are always redeemable 1:1 and its reserves are held in cash and US Treasuries.
>
>Trident Digital is an experienced digital asset solutions provider that works with counterparties to achieve a number of goals across the crypto space. Trident Digital aims to scale stable coin adoption both within and outside the crypto market through strong relationships and experience navigating both the crypto and traditional finance markets. Our previous on-chain work includes facilitation of incentives for the [USDP-PSM](https://messari.io/governor/proposal/57b2db7d-7505-4190-9696-ac2c344e46a2).
>
> While the pyUSD/GHO pool currently holds no funds Trident Digital is working with partners to provide deep liquidity to the pool in the very near future.
>
>## Motivation
>
>This proposal aims to add one new veBAL gauge.
>
>GHO/pyUSD E-CLP - Range: -80bps to 50bps

>## Specification
>
>1. **Governance:** 
>
>* AAVE, aAAVE and stkAAVE serve as the governance tokens for the Aave DAO. Holders can vote on proposals at both a Snapshot level and through the Aave DAO [on-chain governance portal](https://app.aave.com/governance/). 
>
>2. **Oracles:**
>
>No rate providers are used.
>
>* rateProvider0 (for GHO): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider1 (for pyUSD): 0x0 (none)
>
>3. **Audits:**
>
>*Aave v3*
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_ABDK_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin ](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/01-11-2021_OpenZeppelin_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Trail of Bits](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/07-01-2022_TrailOfBits_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Peckshield](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/14-01-2022_PeckShield_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [SigmaPrime](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_SigmaPrime_AaveV3.pdf)
>
>*GHO*
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/02-06-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/07-03-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/01-03-2023_ABDK.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v2](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/10-11-2022_Openzeppelin-v2.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v1](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/12-08-2022_Openzeppelin-v1.pdf)
>
> *pyUSD*
> * [Trail of Bits](https://github.com/paxosglobal/pyusd-contract/blob/master/audit-reports/Trail_of_Bits_Audit_Report.pdf)
> * [Historical database of monthly attestations](https://paxos.com/pyusd-transparency/)
> 
>On the off-chain side Paxos works with [Withum](https://www.withum.com/), a nationally-ranked audit firm, in order to provide timely monthly attestations of reserves backing pyUSD.
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** 
>* Aave Governance is decentralized, and all changes must go through a transparent and well-tested governance process.
>
>* Paxos is a centralized entity functioning in a similar way to Circle, the issuer of USDC. There is no governance structure outside of that dictated by the New York State Department of Financial Services.
>
>* All pyUSD is issued 1:1 against funds held in either cash or US Government Treasuries. All funds backing pyUSD are held bankruptcy remote with New York Banking laws protecting customer funds from being used to satisfy any debt of Paxos.
>
>* The E-CLP Pool type, the FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** 
>* [GHO](https://app.redstone.finance/#/app/token/GHO)
>* [pyUSD](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/paypal-usd)
>
>6. **Value:**
>* This pool is expected to drive meaningful TVL to Balancer and Aura Finance. The assets within the pool are not yield bearing. However, the DAOs will generate revenue from receiving a portion of the swap fees.

>## Pool Details
>Link to Pool: GHO/pyUSD Pool - Range: -80bps to 50bps - [0x4c4Ed61D81F531Dcb34Ad4d498548917ABA3D193](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x4c4ed61d81f531dcb34ad4d498548917aba3d193000200000000000000000680)
>Link to Gauges: B-GHO-pyUSD - [0xb71C90F165cf99d4004499fF058E265Aa68fAC85](https://etherscan.io/address/0xb71C90F165cf99d4004499fF058E265Aa68fAC85) 
>
>Transaction: Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xb71C90F165cf99d4004499fF058E265Aa68fAC85`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

>## Disclosure
>
>This proposal is the work of Tokenlogic and karpatkey who are both Service Providers and delegates within the Aave Ecosystem.

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-539] Enable GHO/USDC E-CLP & GHO/GYD E-CLP Gauges
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-539] Enable GHO/USDC E-CLP & GHO/GYD E-CLP Gauges
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payloads
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/781

>## Summary
>
>@TokenLogic and @karpatkey proposes creating three new gauges and cancelling one unused gauge. 
>
>Three new pools:
>
>GHO/USDC E-CLP - Range: -70bps to 30bps
>GHO/USDC E-CLP - Range: -110bps to 30bps
>GHO/GYD E-CLP - Range: -110bps to 30bps
>
> Depending on the performance of GHO, the Aave Liquidity Committee (ALC) will allocate rewards to the various GHO pools.

>## References/Useful links
>
>**GHO**
>* [Website](https://app.aave.com/markets/)
>* [Documentation](https://docs.aave.com/hub/)
>* [Github Page](https://github.com/aave/interface)
>* [Communities](https://governance.aave.com/)
>
>**GYD**
>* [Slidedeck on E-CLPs](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/16Qt-8PaLJ_1FkaNnI4rocEYUDrG1ktW3u4R6yeSwY68/edit#slide=id.g208e5b00ffd_0_95)
>* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps#description-of-e-clps)
>* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
>* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
>* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
>* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)
>
>## Protocol Description
>
>**GHO & Aave Protocol**
The Aave Protocol is a decentralized liquidity protocol that is deployed across many EVM compatible networks including but not limited to Optimism, Arbitrum, Avalanche and Polygon. Currently, the Aave Protocol has a TVL of approximately $10.7 Billion.
>
>GHO is a decentralized multi-collateral stable coin that is fully backed, transparent and native to the Aave Protocol.
>
>**USDC**
USDC is a digital dollar, also known as a stablecoin, that’s available 24/7 and moves at internet speed. USDC lives natively on the internet, running on many of the world’s most advanced blockchains. Billions of USDC change hands every day1, and every digital dollar of USDC is always redeemable 1:1 for US dollars. - [Circle](https://www.circle.com/en/usdc)
>
> **GYD**
> GYD is an all-weather stablecoin that provides one-stop access to stablecoin risk control. GYD is fully backed by a set of assets with fundamental innovations in risk control built in at the protocol level to automate diversification and redundancy.
>
>These innovations include automated risk diversification rules, optimized minting and redemption design that guides the protocol on how to use reserve assets to maintain stability, and multiple layers of redundancy in price feeds and circuit breakers.


>## Motivation
>
>This proposal aims to add three veBAL gauges and cancelling one unsed gauges.
>
>New Gauges
>GHO/USDC E-CLP - Range: -70bps to 30bps
>GHO/USDC E-CLP - Range: -110bps to 30bps
>GHO/GYD E-CLP - Range: -110bps to 30bps
>
>Unused Gauges
>wETH/GHO - 80/20
>

>## Specification
>
>1. **Governance:** 
>
>* AAVE, aAAVE and stkAAVE serve as the governance tokens for the Aave DAO. Holders can vote on proposals at both a Snapshot level and through the Aave DAO [on-chain governance portal](https://app.aave.com/governance/). 
>
>2. **Oracles:**
>
>No rate providers are used.
>
>* rateProvider0 (for GHO): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider1 (for USDC): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider0 (for GYD): 0x0 (none)
>
>3. **Audits:**
>
>*Aave v3*
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_ABDK_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin ](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/01-11-2021_OpenZeppelin_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Trail of Bits](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/07-01-2022_TrailOfBits_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Peckshield](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/14-01-2022_PeckShield_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [SigmaPrime](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_SigmaPrime_AaveV3.pdf)
>
>*GHO*
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/02-06-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/07-03-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/01-03-2023_ABDK.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v2](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/10-11-2022_Openzeppelin-v2.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v1](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/12-08-2022_Openzeppelin-v1.pdf)
>
>* GYD*
>Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** 
>* Aave Governance is decentralized, and all changes must go through a transparent and well-tested governance process.
>
>* Circle is a centralised entity with control over which addresses can transfer there stable coin.
>
>* Gyroscope's GYD, no centralization vectors. 
>
>* The E-CLP Pool type, the FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** 
>* USDC is widely used across many liquidity pools.
> GHO and GYD have limited market history
>
>6. **Value:**
>* This pool is expected to drive meaningful TVL to Balancer and Aura Finance. The assets within the pool are not yield bearing. However, the DAOs will generate revenue from receiving a portion of the swap fees.

>## Pool Details
>Link to Pool: GHO/USDC Pool - Range: -70bps to 30bps - [0x3932b187f440cE7703653b3908EDc5bB7676C283](https://etherscan.io/address/0x3932b187f440cE7703653b3908EDc5bB7676C283)
>Link to Gauges: B-GHO-USDC - [0xa2F8bd6B95a0cB9094206075504CD0ED1Cc717Be](https://etherscan.io/address/0xa2F8bd6B95a0cB9094206075504CD0ED1Cc717Be) 
>
>Link to Pool: GHO/USDC Pool - Range: -110bps to 30bps - [0x99e7b15df044e1b62e2e1774fD4469d54D9409aC](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x99e7b15df044e1b62e2e1774fd4469d54d9409ac00020000000000000000065a)
>Link to Gauges: B-GHO-USDC - [0x80AeF246F9926B52622f4e74cdc7Acb5C4344FfE](https://etherscan.io/address/0x80AeF246F9926B52622f4e74cdc7Acb5C4344FfE) 
>
>Link to Pool: GHO/GYD Pool - Range: -110bps to 30bps - [0xaA7a70070E7495fe86c67225329DbD39BAa2F63b](https://etherscan.io/address/0xaA7a70070E7495fe86c67225329DbD39BAa2F63b)
>Link to Gauges: B-GHO-GYD - [0x4a7475D32CCD29edD65b2a1712b091aA741ba9BB](https://etherscan.io/address/0x4a7475D32CCD29edD65b2a1712b091aA741ba9BB) 
>
>Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
> gauge(address):`0xa2F8bd6B95a0cB9094206075504CD0ED1Cc717Be`
> gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`
> 
> gauge(address):`0x80AeF246F9926B52622f4e74cdc7Acb5C4344FfE`
> gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`
>
> gauge(address):`0x4a7475D32CCD29edD65b2a1712b091aA741ba9BB`
> gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`


>## Disclosure
>
>This proposal is the work of Tokenlogic and karpatkey who are both Service Providers and delegates within the Aave Ecosystem.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-411] Enable GHO/USDT/USDC Gauge [Ethereum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
Payload with PR:

https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/484

**Summary:**

>This pool uses the ComposableStablePoolFactory-v5 which addresses the [reentrancy vulnerability](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/reentrancy-vulnerability-scope-expanded/4345) disclosed during February 2023. This pool is to be uncapped.
>
>This proposal is for the creation of a new 3pool, GHO / USDT / USDC, on Ethereum.
>
**References/Useful links:**

>*GHO*
>* [Website](https://app.aave.com/markets/)
>* [Documentation](https://docs.aave.com/hub/)
>* [Github Page](https://github.com/aave/interface)
>* [Communities](https://governance.aave.com/)

**Protocol Description:**

>*Aave Protocol*
The Aave Protocol is a decentralized liquidity protocol that is deployed across many EVM compatible networks including but not limited to Optimism, Arbitrum, Avalanche and Polygon. Currently, the Aave Protocol has a TVL of approximately $6.9 Billion.
>
>* GHO is a decentralized multi-collateral stable coin that is fully backed, transparent and native to the Aave Protocol.
>* USDT is a centralised stable coin issued by Tether. 
>* USDC is a centralised stable coin issued by Circle. 

**Motivation:**

>This proposal aims to add a veBAL gauge for GHO-USDC-USDT.
>
>This pool has the potential to be added to Aave DAO's SM at a later date if the Aave DAO elects to do so.
>
> Some veBAL holders prefer to support this new 3pool instead of GHO/BPT (USDC/DAI/USDT)
>
**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** 

>* AAVE and stkAAVE serve as the governance tokens for the Aave DAO. Holders can vote on proposals at both a Snapshot level and through the Aave DAO [on-chain governance portal](https://app.aave.com/governance/). 

2. **Oracles:**

>* rateProvider0 (for GHO): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider1 (for USDT): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider1 (for USDC): 0x0 (none)

3. **Audits:**

>*Aave v3*
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_ABDK_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin ](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/01-11-2021_OpenZeppelin_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Trail of Bits](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/07-01-2022_TrailOfBits_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Peckshield](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/14-01-2022_PeckShield_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [SigmaPrime](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_SigmaPrime_AaveV3.pdf)

>*GHO*
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/02-06-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/07-03-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/01-03-2023_ABDK.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v2](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/10-11-2022_Openzeppelin-v2.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v1](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/12-08-2022_Openzeppelin-v1.pdf)

4. **Centralization vectors:** 
>* Aave Governance is decentralized, and all changes must go through a transparent and well-tested governance process.
>* Tether and Circle are both centralised entities with control over which addresses can transfer there stable coin.

5. **Market History:** 
>* GHO is used in several liquidity pools
>* USDC and USDT are widely used across many liquidity pools.

6. **Value:**
>* This pool is expected to drive meaningful TVL to Balancer and Aura Finance. The assets within the pool are not yield bearing. However, the DAOs will generate revenue from receiving a portion of the swap fees.

**Pool Details**
>Link to Pool: GHO-USDT-USDC Pool - [0x8353157092ED8Be69a9DF8F95af097bbF33Cb2aF](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x8353157092ed8be69a9df8f95af097bbf33cb2af0000000000000000000005d9)
>Link to Gauges: B-GHO-USDT-USDC - [0xf720e9137baa9C7612e6CA59149a5057ab320cFa](https://etherscan.io/address/0xf720e9137baa9C7612e6CA59149a5057ab320cFa) 

> **Specification**: 
>
> The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xf720e9137baa9C7612e6CA59149a5057ab320cFa`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

**Disclosure:**

>This proposal is the work of Tokenlogic who is a delegate within the Aave Ecosystem.
>Details on TokenLogics delegation platform can be found [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/tokenlogic-delegate-platform/12516).

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-717] Enable GHO/wUSDL Gauge on Arbitrum
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR With Payload:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1423

> ## Summary
>
>@TokenLogic and @karpatkey proposes creating a gauge for the new GHO/USDL ComposableStable Pool on Arbitrum.
>
> GHO/wUSDL Pool - Composable Stable Amp 500
>
>This gauge would enter as a “core pool” under BIP-19, meaning protocol fees earned by this pool would be used to bribe for votes on it.
 
>## References/Useful links
>
>**GHO**
>* [Website](https://app.aave.com/markets/)
>* [Documentation](https://docs.aave.com/hub/)
>* [Github Page](https://github.com/aave/interface)
>* [Communities](https://governance.aave.com/)
>
>**wUSDL**
>* [Website](https://liftdollar.com/)
>* [Documentation](https://docs.liftdollar.com/)
>* [WhitePaper](https://whitepaper.liftdollar.com/index.html)
>* [X](https://x.com/LiftDollar_USDL)
 
>## Protocol Description
>
>**GHO & Aave Protocol**
The Aave Protocol is a decentralized liquidity protocol that is deployed across many EVM compatible networks including but not limited to Optimism, Arbitrum, Avalanche and Polygon. Currently, the Aave Protocol has a TVL of approximately $10.7 Billion.
>
>GHO is a decentralized multi-collateral stable coin that is fully backed, transparent and native to the Aave Protocol.
>
>**wUSDL & Paxos**
>
> USDL is issued by Paxos International which is regulated by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) in Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM).
>
>Lift Dollar (USDL) is an ERC-20 token that distributes yield generated by its cash and cash equivalent reserve assets through a daily rebasing mechanism embedded in the smart contract. The wrapped version of USDL, wUSDL, compounds the yield over time to provide holders with a native savings rate. 
>
>USDL Contract Address: [`0x7f850b0ab1988dd17b69ac564c1e2857949e4dee`](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7f850b0ab1988dd17b69ac564c1e2857949e4dee)
>wUSDL Contract Address: [`0x7751e2f4b8ae93ef6b79d86419d42fe3295a4559`](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7751e2f4b8ae93ef6b79d86419d42fe3295a4559
)

>## Motivation
>
>This proposal is to enable BAL emissions to the following gauge:
>
>* GHO/wUSDL ComposableStable Pool on Arbitrum Amp 1,000
>
>Paxos is expected to provide 5M initial liquidity to seed the pool.
>
>At a later date, when Gyroscope has progressed through Paxo's risk assessment process, this pool may transition to an ECLP. To support the launch of USDL, the Composable Stable pool type was preferred.

>## Specification
>
>1. **Governance:** 
>
>* AAVE, aAAVE and stkAAVE serve as the governance tokens for the Aave DAO. Holders can vote on proposals at both a Snapshot level and through the Aave DAO [on-chain governance portal](https://app.aave.com/governance/).
> 
>* Paxos International is a Paxos-affiliate company based in the Abu Dhabi Global Market, the financial free zone of Abu-Dhabi Emirates in UAE. Paxos International’s corporate activities and performance are overseen by a Board of Directors.
>
>2. **Oracles:**
>
>* rateProvider0 (for GHO): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider1 (for wUSDL): 
>
>3. **Audits:**
>
>*Aave v3*
>
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_ABDK_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin ](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/01-11-2021_OpenZeppelin_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Trail of Bits](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/07-01-2022_TrailOfBits_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Peckshield](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/14-01-2022_PeckShield_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [SigmaPrime](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_SigmaPrime_AaveV3.pdf)
>
>*GHO*
>
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/02-06-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/07-03-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/01-03-2023_ABDK.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v2](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/10-11-2022_Openzeppelin-v2.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v1](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/12-08-2022_Openzeppelin-v1.pdf)
>
>*wUSDL*
>
>* [Audits](https://support.liftdollar.com/hc/en-us/articles/25044783537300-Audit-Requests) can be requested with a Paxos International registered email address. 
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** 
>
>* Aave Governance is decentralized, and all changes must go through a transparent and well-tested governance process.
>
>* Paxos governance is centralised company overseen by a Board of Directors.
>
>5. **Market History:** 
>
>* GHO recently launched on Arbitrum whilst USDL is preparing to launch.
>
>6. **Value:**
>
>* GHO/wUSDL is to be onboarded as a Core Pool with a portion of the wUSDL yield to accrue to the Balancer treasury. 

>## Pool Details
>
>Link to Pool: GHO/wUSDL Pool - Composable Stable
>Link to Gauges: B-GHO-wUSDL - Root Gauge: [0x2e8A05f0216c6cC43BC123EE7dEf58901d3844D2](https://etherscan.io/address/0x2e8A05f0216c6cC43BC123EE7dEf58901d3844D2#readContract) 
> Child Chain Gauge: [0xcC014e60585259dA1C8501b00789521659e7a4fC](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xcC014e60585259dA1C8501b00789521659e7a4fC#readContract) 
>
>The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
>gauge(address): `0x2e8A05f0216c6cC43BC123EE7dEf58901d3844D2`
>gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

>## Disclosure
>
>This proposal is the work of TokenLogic and karpatkey who are both Service Providers and delegates within the Aave Ecosystem.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-650] Enable GHO Gauges on Arbitrum
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1110

>## Summary
>
>@TokenLogic and @karpatkey proposes creating four new gauges in collaboration with Gyroscope and Balancer. 
>
>Four new pools:
>
>GHO/USDe Pool - Range: -50bps to 50bps
>GHO/aArbUSDC Pool - Range: -40bps to 2bps
>GHO/GYD Pool - Range: -40bps to 2bps
>GHO/USDC/USDT Pool - Composable Stable Amp 750
>
>## References/Useful links
>
>**GHO**
>* [Website](https://app.aave.com/markets/)
>* [Documentation](https://docs.aave.com/hub/)
>* [Github Page](https://github.com/aave/interface)
>* [Communities](https://governance.aave.com/)
>
>**GYD**
>* [Slidedeck on E-CLPs](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/16Qt-8PaLJ_1FkaNnI4rocEYUDrG1ktW3u4R6yeSwY68/edit#slide=id.g208e5b00ffd_0_95)
>* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps#description-of-e-clps)
>* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
>* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
>* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
>* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)
>
>**USDe**
>* [Website](https://www.ethena.fi/)
>* [Documentation](https://ethena-labs.gitbook.io/ethena-labs/)
>* [Fundraising News](https://twitter.com/leptokurtic_/status/1759546368467849577?s=20)
>* [Communities](https://twitter.com/ethena_labs/status/1759546702187696437?s=20)
>
>## Protocol Description
>
>**GHO & Aave Protocol**
The Aave Protocol is a decentralized liquidity protocol that is deployed across many EVM compatible networks including but not limited to Optimism, Arbitrum, Avalanche and Polygon. Currently, the Aave Protocol has a TVL of approximately $10.7 Billion.
>
>GHO is a decentralized multi-collateral stable coin that is fully backed, transparent and native to the Aave Protocol.
>
>**USDC**
USDC is a digital dollar, also known as a stablecoin, that’s available 24/7 and moves at internet speed. USDC lives natively on the internet, running on many of the world’s most advanced blockchains. Billions of USDC change hands every day1, and every digital dollar of USDC is always redeemable 1:1 for US dollars. - [Circle](https://www.circle.com/en/usdc)
>
>**GYD**
> GYD is an all-weather stablecoin that provides one-stop access to stablecoin risk control. GYD is fully backed by a set of assets with fundamental innovations in risk control built in at the protocol level to automate diversification and redundancy.
>
>These innovations include automated risk diversification rules, optimized minting and redemption design that guides the protocol on how to use reserve assets to maintain stability, and multiple layers of redundancy in price feeds and circuit breakers.[-Gyroscope](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-491-enable-3-gyd-stablecoin-gauges-ethereum/5357)
>
>**USDT**
>
>All Tether tokens (USD₮) are pegged at 1-to-1 with a matching fiat currency and are backed 100% by Tether’s reserves.[- Tether](https://tether.to/en/)
>
>**USDe & Ethena**
>
>Ethena is a synthetic dollar protocol built on Ethereum that provides a crypto-native solution for money not reliant on traditional banking system infrastructure, alongside a globally accessible dollar denominated savings instrument - the ‘Internet Bond’.
>
>Ethena’s synthetic dollar, USDe, provides a stable crypto-native solution for money achieved by delta-hedging staked Ethereum collateral. USDe is fully collateralized and free to compose throughout DeFi.
>
>USDe peg stability is ensured through the use of delta hedging derivatives positions against protocol-held collateral.
>
>## Motivation
>
>This proposal aims to add four veBAL gauges:
>
>**New Gauges**
>
>GHO/USDe Pool - Range: -50bps to 50bps
>GHO/aArbUSDC Pool - Range: -40bps to 2bps
>GHO/GYD Pool - Range: -40bps to 2bps
>GHO/USDC/USDT Pool - Composable Stable Amp 750
>
>## Specification
>
>1. **Governance:** 
>
>* AAVE, aAAVE and stkAAVE serve as the governance tokens for the Aave DAO. Holders can vote on proposals at both a Snapshot level and through the Aave DAO [on-chain governance portal](https://app.aave.com/governance/).
> 
>* Ethena currently operates with a multi-signature wallet, featuring doxxed founding contributors. The protocol is planning to decentralize strategy management to shards holders and transition to decentralized governance in the future.
>
>* The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
>
>2. **Oracles:**
>
>* rateProvider0 (for GHO): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider1 (for aArbUSDC): 
>* rateProvider0 (for GYD): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider0 (for USDe): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider0 (for USDC): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider0 (for USDT): 0x0 (none)
>
>3. **Audits:**
>
>*Aave v3*
>
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_ABDK_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin ](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/01-11-2021_OpenZeppelin_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Trail of Bits](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/07-01-2022_TrailOfBits_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Peckshield](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/14-01-2022_PeckShield_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [SigmaPrime](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_SigmaPrime_AaveV3.pdf)
>
>*GHO*
>
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/02-06-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/07-03-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/01-03-2023_ABDK.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v2](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/10-11-2022_Openzeppelin-v2.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v1](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/12-08-2022_Openzeppelin-v1.pdf)
>
>*GYD*
>
>Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.
>
>*USDe*
>
>Ethena has undertaken a multi-phased audit program to ensure the highest level of security on the procotol.
>
>* Phase 1: conducted initial audit with Zellic on the v1 of the protocol where no critical or high level vulnerabilities were found.
>* Phase 2: architecture design review and economic risk factor analysis with Spearbit’s Kurt Barry former Lead Engineer at MakerDAO
>* Phase 3: phased audit with industry leading firms: Quantstamp, Spearbit & Cantina
>* Phase 4: independent audit with Pashov with individual experience of over 50 audits
>* Phase 5: public audit with Code4rena
>* Phase 6: economic and financial risk audit by Chaos Labs
>* Phase 7: upcoming public bug bounty program with Immunefi
>
> Copies of the audits can be found [here](https://ethena-labs.gitbook.io/ethena-labs/resources/audits)
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** 
>
>* Aave Governance is decentralized, and all changes must go through a transparent and well-tested governance process.
>
>* Circle are both centralised entities with control over which addresses can transfer there stable coin.
>
>* Gyroscope's GYD, no centralization vectors. 
>
>* Ethena's USDe, centralizatio vectors can be found [here](https://ethena.notion.site/Ethena-FAQs-3ccc1437e13343f8b74c0d005e4f5128)
>
>* The E-CLP Pool type, the FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** 
>
>* GHO is in the process of being released on Arbitrum.
>* USDC and USDT are widely used across many liquidity pools
>* USDe has relatively short history on Arbitrum.
>* GYD has recently launched on Arbitrum.
>
>6. **Value:**
>
>* These pools are expected to drive meaningful TVL to Balancer and Aura Finance. Liquidity providers can expect to receive, Spin Points from Gyroscope, Sats from Ethena, vlAURA voting support from Balancer Maxi + ALC and ARB from Gyrscope + ALC + Balancer Maxi. 
>
>## Pool Details
>
>Link to Pool: [GHO/USDe Pool - Range: -50bps to 50bps](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x2B783cD37774BB77d387D35683e8388937712f0a)
>Link to Gauges: [Arbitrum](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xf2d151c40C18d8097AAa5157eE8f447CBe217269) & [Ethereum](https://etherscan.io/address/0xE03b4CB39C54EedFe4E46677511989866A88dbE3) 
>
>Link to Pool: [GHO/aArbUSDC Pool - Range: -40bps to 2bps](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x46472CBA35E6800012aA9fcC7939Ff07478C473E)
>Link to Gauges: [Arbitrum](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x6e654787251ae77Fe1873f93A5f220E00afa90E8) & [Ethereum](https://etherscan.io/address/0x27213687F92cdA21F10cc09A3e860B6D817Ef096
)
>
>Link to Pool: [GHO/GYD Pool - Range: -40bps to 2bps](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xBc88FA2aeb274326ae3F2c66139D5Eb33D1F5C2E)
>Link to Gauges: [Arbitrum](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x08f3e8A507E51c436f301afc77Fb725486b1307a) & [Ethereum](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9434c3955920A1FeD5e28ebCCEF80dCd54DEA180
)
>
>Link to Pool: GHO/USDC/USDT Pool - [Composable Stable](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xf890360473c12d8015da8dbf7af11da87337a065000000000000000000000570)
>Linke to Gauges: B-GHO-USDC-USDT - [Arbitrum](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7d907D8D66B6CAd285D4349F507EcdfD11FD23D2) - [Ethereum](https://etherscan.io/address/0x6DD48C4858dd84738E2A347881D66761C964CE3F) 
>
>The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860 will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
> 
>These pools will be seeded with liquidity just prior to GHO officially launching on Arbitrum. 
>
>gauge(address): `0xE03b4CB39C54EedFe4E46677511989866A88dbE3`
>gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`
>
>gauge(address): `0x27213687F92cdA21F10cc09A3e860B6D817Ef096`
>gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`
>
>gauge(address): `0x9434c3955920A1FeD5e28ebCCEF80dCd54DEA180`
>gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`
>
>gauge(address): `0x6DD48C4858dd84738E2A347881D66761C964CE3F`
>gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`


>## Disclosure
>
>This proposal is the work of TokenLogic and karpatkey who are both Service Providers and delegates within the Aave Ecosystem.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal seeks to enable a new GHO/PYUSD E-CLP gauge on Ethereum, supported by key ecosystem participants, and to deprecate an outdated gauge. The vote shows unanimous support with positive forum sentiment and aligned timeline metrics. Similar past proposals for gauge enabling also succeeded and led to positive market and TVL impacts.
key_arguments_for: Enables a new gauge expected to increase TVL and protocol revenue from swap fees.
Supported by major stakeholders including Aave Liquidity Committee, Trident Digital, and Paxos.
Unanimous voting timeline and positive forum sentiment indicate strong community backing.
Similar prior proposals enabling gauges showed positive market responses and success.
key_arguments_against: Centralization risk due to Paxos governance model for PYUSD.
Existing gauge must be deprecated carefully to avoid user confusion.

evidence.quote: Forum posts are mostly positive, with one neutral; community supports enabling the new gauge.
Voting timeline shows consistent and stable lead for 'Yes, let's do it' option.
Two similar proposals enabling gauges with unanimous 'Yes' votes and positive market impacts.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline voting metrics show a stable and unanimous lead for 'Yes, let's do it' throughout the voting period.
- Forum sentiment analysis indicates positive community support with no negative comments, aligning with the vote recommendation.
- Adjacent similar proposals to enable gauges were successful and had positive market and TVL impacts, supporting the anticipated benefits.
- The proposal aligns with long-term protocol health by increasing TVL and revenue while removing outdated gauges, despite some centralization considerations with PYUSD governance.
- The recommendation mirrors aggregated forum opinion and voting trends, ensuring community alignment.
